title: New fungi species unearthed in Cairngorms mountains
description: The discoveries included a fungus previously recorded in the Arctic and another in Antarctica.

title: Vincent Van Gogh: Hidden self-portrait discovered by X-ray
description: The work was discovered on the back of another of the artist's paintings in a Scottish gallery.

title: 'Why I invented Non-binary Day'
description: Katje van Loon had the idea for International Non-Binary day - half way between International Women's Day and International Men's Day.

title: Conservative candidates compete with campaign videos
description: Several candidates for leader have made slick campaign videos to try and get their message across.

title: 'Phantom of the Open': How Maurice Flitcroft tricked the R&A
description: Maurice Flitcroft was the 'Phantom of the Open' - an undaunted amateur who tricked his way into competing among golf's elite.

title: Netherlands survive a scare to see off Portugal
description: Danielle van de Donk scores a fine winner as defending champions the Netherlands survive a scare to defeat Portugal in an action-packed Euro 2022 encounter.

title: Boris Johnson: The inside story of the prime minister's downfall
description: Laura Kuenssberg looks at what finally made the prime minister change his mind about quitting.

title: Euro 2022: Sweden secure first Group C win against Switzerland
description: Teenage substitute Hanna Bennison scores the winning goal as Sweden overcome Switzerland to earn their first victory at Euro 2022.

title: Euro 2022: Tell us about your tournament experiences so far
description: Have you been to any of the Euro 2022 games so far this summer? Let us know your stories.

title: BBC Travel Watchers: Share your summer travel experience
description: Tell us about your journeys this summer.

title: Extreme weather warning extended to Tuesday
description: Temperatures are set to peak on Monday, with highs of 36C forecast for parts of south-east England.

title: Raheem Sterling confirms Manchester City departure before Chelsea move
description: England forward Raheem Sterling confirms his departure from Manchester City before a £50m move to Chelsea.

title: Telford child sex abuse survivor: There was a stream of men
description: Emily Vaughn told the inquiry of her experiences but questions if anything will change as a result.

title: Energy suppliers told to review soaring direct debits
description: It comes after 500,000 households saw their direct debit payments double earlier this year.

title: Summer holiday: 'We spent 15 hours on a flight to nowhere'
description: Mark and Caroline Gittins ended up back where they started, after strong winds diverted their flight to Madeira.

title: Conservative leader rivals await result of MPs' votes
description: Tory MPs are holding their first round of voting on who they want to replace Boris Johnson in No 10.

title: Uefa Liverpool final: String of errors in French handling, says report
description: A French Senate inquiry finds Liverpool fans were unfairly blamed for the failings at the stadium.

title: Sri Lanka: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa flees the country on military jet
description: Gotabaya Rajapaksa has arrived in the Maldives amid mass protests over Sri Lanka's economic crisis.

title: DJ Tim Westwood accused of sex with a 14-year-old
description: The woman's accusation is revealed as part of a BBC News investigation into new claims of sexual abuse.

title: Amy Turner leaves England to become Harlequins head coach
description: Amy Turner, who was set to be part of England's coaching staff at the World Cup, joins Harlequins Women as head coach.

title: Raphinha: Leeds United agree deal with Barcelona for Brazil forward
description: Leeds United's Raphinha is set to join Barcelona after the two clubs agree a deal "in principle" for the Brazil forward.

title: UK economy grows but fears remain over rising prices
description: The economy grew by 0.5% in May, higher than most economists expected.

title: Sri Lanka: Inside the prime minister's office stormed by protesters
description: The BBC's Rajini Vaidyanathan is with the protesters who flooded into the PM's office in Colombo.

title: Molly-Mae Hague has Pretty Little Thing Instagram post banned
description: The influencer didn't make it clear the picture of her in a Pretty Little Thing dress was an ad.

title: Market flooded by unsafe vapes aimed at children
description: Doctors say more needs to be done to protect children from illegal, unregulated products containing nicotine.

title: Sri Lanka: Why is the country in an economic crisis?
description: A state of emergency has been declared after months of protests across the country.

title: Shark spotted in River Stour leaves woman 'amazed'
description: She says the shark did not seem to be worried by paddleboarders as it swam near a town centre.

title: Sir Mo Farah 'relieved' Home Office won't take action over citizenship
description: It comes after Sir Mo Farah revealed he was trafficked to the UK as a child.

title: Jurgen Klopp: Liverpool manager to be given freedom of the city
description: The German manager has won six major trophies in nearly seven years at Anfield.

title: Chris Mason: Our next PM is still far from obvious
description: The only electorate that matters in choosing the two candidates are the 358 people who are Tory MPs.

title: Skateboarding Hull sisters acting as role models for others
description: Three Hull sisters who post raps and skateboard footage on social media aim to inspire others.

title: Violet sea snails spotted in Isles of Scilly
description: About 60 of the "mesmerizing and completely alien" snails have been reported on the Isles of Scilly.

title: The Papers: 'Stop Rishi' push and Britain on heat 'red alert'
description: Moves by allies of Boris Johnson to stop Rishi Sunak becoming Tory leader and fears over the coming heatwave feature on the front pages.

title: Football floodlights were used in Loch Ness Monster hunt
description: Details of the events 89 years ago were uncovered as part of a football memories project.

title: Shah Rukh Khan: Why the actor's charm has endured the test of time
description: Thirty years after he began his career, the actor remains among the world's biggest film icons.

title: Cost of living: Why are things so hard for so many people?
description: Five charts show why low-quality work, high rent and flat wages mean price rises are hitting hard.
